subject: Communication
title: Attention Spans: The 10-Minute Rule
description: Learn Attention Spans: The 10-Minute Rule in one minute.

hook.text: After about ten minutes of listening, your audience's attention drops off a cliff.

buildup.text: Neuroscience research shows focused attention maxes out around 10-15 minutes before needing a reset.

discovery.text: TED capped talks at 18 minutes for exactly this reason â€” it forces speakers to be concise.

twist.text: You can restart the clock with 'pattern interrupts' â€” a story, a question, a video, or a shift in energy.

climax.text: Great speakers don't fight biology. They structure their talks in 10-minute blocks with resets between.

punchline.text: Respect the clock in your audience's brain.
